intro: Calceolaria tenerifolia, commonly known as the Canary Island slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive slipper-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, adapting to the arid conditions of its natural habitat. Calceolaria tenerifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
